dsDescriptionValue.value:
Description:
Ophiuchus North-West (including cores A-I) mapped in Sub-millimetre continuum 850 micron. The observations were obtained with SCUBA in fast-scanning mode at the JCMT during March-June 2003. Additional sections of the cloud are still be be observed/processed. Flux units are in Jys per 15 arcsecond beam.

Telescope:
JCMT

Status:
Finished

Sampling:
Se nsitivity: 40 mJy per beam
Waveband: 850 microns
Resolution: 15 arcseconds (large > 2 arcminute structure chopped out)

Areal Coverage:
2x2 degrees

Map Center (Galactic):
NA
NA

Map Center (J2000):
RA = 16:25:00
Dec = -23:40:00

Comments on Processing:
Steps performed: flatfield, depsike, weather, chop deconvolution (see Johnstone et al. 2000, ApJS, 131, 505)

publicationCitation.value: Doug Johnstone, James Di Francesco, Helen Kirk, An Extinction Threshold for Protostellar Cores in Ophiuchus, 2004, ApJ, 611, L45-L48.
